title: New York State Mathematics Test Analysis
driving_question: How can we analyze and understand the structure and demands of the New York State Mathematics Test?
short_background_context: In 2013, New York State began administering tests designed to assess student performance in accordance with the instructional shifts and rigor demanded by the new New York State P-12 Learning Standards in Mathematics. These tests are designed with multiple-choice questions, short-response questions, and extended-response questions, each assessing different aspects of mathematical understanding and application. The questions are often framed within the context of real-world applications and require students to complete multiple steps, drawing on the simultaneous application of multiple skills and concepts.
tasks: Analyze a set of multiple-choice questions from the 2019 test and identify the mathematical concepts and skills they are designed to assess.
Choose a short-response question from the 2019 test and explain the steps required to solve it, identifying the mathematical concepts and skills involved.

Choose an extended-response question from the 2019 test and break down the tasks involved in solving it. Explain how it assesses understanding of mathematical procedures, conceptual understanding, and application.
pre_thinking_prompts: What do you know about the structure of the New York State Mathematics Test?
What mathematical concepts and skills do you think the test is designed to assess?
How do you think the test questions are designed to assess these concepts and skills?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on how your understanding of the structure and demands of the New York State Mathematics Test has changed after completing this mission. What new insights have you gained?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain why you think this question is designed to assess these particular skills and concepts?
How does the context of the question relate to the mathematical concepts and skills being assessed?
Can you identify any other skills or concepts that might be relevant to solving this question?
remix_zone: Students could remix this problem by designing their own test questions that assess the same mathematical concepts and skills, or by analyzing test questions from a different year or a different state.
